lines.content: > ‚ÄúThe bad news is time flies. The good news is you‚Äôre the pilot‚Äù
Mike is a *simple task manager* bot. It is
1. Add tasks (3 types - todos, deadlines, events) to a list
2. Perform basic functions on the list
3. Store the list in hard drive for future reference.
- [ ] Run the jar file with java
Find the User Guide here: https://brelkh.github.io/ip/
Know [Java](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/)? Feel free to fork it and edit code as you please!
JavaFX code used in this project is adapted from that present in the [SE-EDU JavaFX tutorial](https://se-education.org/guides/tutorials/javaFx.html).

Mike is a simple and efficient task manager app that works on desktops.
It uses a Command Line Interface to take in user commands but has the
added benefit of responding to the user on a Graphical User Interface for
more seamless interaction. It allows users to manage 3 types of tasks - Todos,
Description: Add a new todo to the stored list of tasks.
Description: Add a new event to the stored list of tasks.
Description: Add a new deadline to the stored list of tasks.
Description: Presents a list of all the tasks ordered by their index number.
Description: Remove a task from the list of tasks by its index number.
Description: Mark a task from the list of tasks as done by its index number.
Description: Unmark a task from the list of tasks as done by its index number.
Description: Find tasks in the list of tasks that have names containing
### Save the data to hard drive
Description: The program automatically saves the task list to the hard drive
after each command that changes the data in the task list.
Description: Exit the program and close the window.
* Represents a deadline task. A deadline is a task with a "by" date.
* @param isDone Whether deadline is marked as done.
public Deadline(String name, String endDate, boolean isDone) {
* Returns a new deadline object with the isDone field set to true.
* @return Deadline object with isDone set to true.
* Returns a new deadline object with the isDone field set to false.
* @return Deadline object with isDone set to false.
* Returns the deadline as a String in a format that can be stored.
* Returns a String representing the deadline object.

public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Returns a DialogBox based on output from Mike.
* @return DialogBox based on output from Mike.
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Represents an event task. An event is a task with an "at" date.
* @param isDone Whether event is marked as done.
public Event(String name, String eventDate, boolean isDone) {
* Returns a new event object with the isDone field set to true.
* @return Event object with isDone set to true.
* Returns a new event object with the isDone field set to false.
* @return Event object with isDone set to false.
* Returns the event as a String in a format that can be stored.
* Returns a String representing the event object.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI to initialise Mike with FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for other controls.
* Represents an instance of "Mike" - a simple task manager app.
* This class handles the logic behind managing user input.
* Returns a string with a message for the user when no characters are entered.
* @return String with a message for the user when no characters are entered.
* Adds a task of type "To-do" to the list
* @param str The name of the task to be added to the list.
* @return String to be output to the user by Mike.
* Adds a task of type "Deadline" to the list.
* @param name The name of the task and its deadline in the format "taskName /by deadline".
* @param date The date of the deadline represented as a String.
* @return String to be output to the user by Mike.
private String addDeadline(String name, String date) {
return ("You probably keyed in a deadline with the wrong format\n"
* Adds a task of type "Event" to the list.
* @param name The name of the task and the time of the event in the format "taskName /at eventTime".
* @param scheduledDate The date of the event represented as a String.
* @return String to be output to the user by Mike.
private String addEvent(String name, String scheduledDate) {
return ("You probably keyed in an event with the wrong format\n"
* Marks the task (specified by its index in the list) as "done".
* @param indexFromUser The index of the task (as seen by the user) to be marked in the list.
* @return String to be output to the user by Mike.
* Unmarks the task (specified by its index in the list) as "done".
* @param indexFromUser The index of the task (as seen by the user) to be unmarked in the list.
* @return String to be output to the user by Mike.
* Processes the user's input then and responds accordingly.
"Hmm, you may have entered the command arguments incorrectly.\n"
+ "Tip: Enter dates in the format yyyy-mm-dd";
String indexOutOfBoundsMessage = "That item number doesn't exist on your list :/";
* Stores the current list in the hard drive to be accessed on reboot of Mike.
* Loads the list from a previous session that is stored in the hard drive.
* @param userInput The String to be parsed.
* Returns the command portion of the user input.
* @return String representing the command from a user's input.
* Returns the index portion of the user input.
* @return An integer representing the index of a task in the list.
* Returns true if the user input is the exit command ("bye").
* @return boolean representing whether the user has input the exit command.
* Returns true if the user input does not contain any characters.
* @return boolean representing whether the user has input a String without characters.
* Removes the "command" portion out from the input string and returns the remainder of the string.
* @return The input string from the user with the "command" portion removed.
* Returns the name of a to-do after processing the user input.
* @return String representing the name of a to-do.
* Returns the name of a deadline after processing the user input.
* @return String representing the name of a deadline.
assert indexOfBy >= 0 : "index should be more than or equal to 0";
* Returns the date of a deadline after processing the user input.
* @return String representing the date of a deadline.
assert indexOfEndDate >= 0 : "index should be more than or equal to 0";
* Returns the name of an event after processing the user input.
* @return String representing the name of an event.
assert indexOfBy >= 0 : "index should be more than or equal to 0";
* Returns the date of an event after processing the user input.
* @return String representing the date of an event.
* Returns the keywords to be searched for from user input.
* @return The keywords to be searched for.
//Todo:fix bug where if user inputs "find", it searches for occurrences of "find".
* Handles to storage and retrieval of information from the hard drive.
* @param filePath FilePath of the file that should be stored or retrieved.
* Loads the file to be accessed.
assert !this.filePath.isEmpty() : "filePath should not be an empty string";
* Stores the list in the specified filePath.
* @param listInStorageFormat A String representation of the entire list of tasks.
* @param isDone Whether task is to be marked as done.
* Returns the name of the task.
* Returns true if the task name contains the specified search words.
* @param searchWords Words to be searched for in the task name.
* @return Returns true if the task name contains the search words; else returns false.
* Returns a String representing the task.
* Handles the operations on the list of tasks managed by the app.
* Returns a string representation of the tasks that can be output for the user.
* @return String representing the full list of tasks.
* Returns a String to be printed acknowledging that the user has added a task to the list.
* @param task Task that has been added to the list
* @return String to be printed that acknowledges the new list item.
String addTaskOutput = "Added \"" + taskName + "\" to the list!";
String noOfTasksOutput = String.format("You now have *%d* task(s) in your list.", noOfTasks);
* Removes the task (specified by its index) from the list and returns a String message.
* @param removeIndex The index of the task to be removed from the list.
* @return String to be printed that acknowledges the removal of the list item.
String removeTaskOutput = "Removed \"" + taskName + "\" from the list!";
String noOfTasksOutput = String.format("You now have *%d* task(s) in your list.", noOfTasks);
* Marks the task (specified by its index) as done and returns a String message.
* @param indexFromUser The index of the task to be marked in the list.
* @return String to be printed that acknowledges the marking of the list item.
assert indexInList >= 0 : "index should be more than or equal to 0";
String.format("Great job, \"%s\" marked as done!", newTask.getTaskName());
* Marks the task (specified by its index) as undone and returns a String message.
* @param indexFromUser The index of the task to be marked in the list.
* @return String to be printed that acknowledges the unmarking of the list item.
assert indexInList >= 0 : "index should be more than or equal to 0";
String.format("Sure thing, \"%s\" marked as undone!", newTask.getTaskName());
* Returns a String representing the tasks that the user is searching for.
* @return String with the tasks the user is looking for.
* Returns a String representing the TaskList that can be stored.
* @return String representation of TaskList for storage.
* Returns a new TaskList from the information in storedList.txt stored in the hard drive.
* @param file The file in which data about the list of tasks is stored.
* @return A new TaskList based on the information in the hard drive (storedList.txt file).
+ "New file \"storedList.txt\" has been created for you.**");
* Returns a task object after processing a string from storedList.txt.
* @param input String (from storedList.txt) containing details of the task.
* @return A task object instantiated with parameters provided by the input string.
Deadline deadline = new Deadline(deadlineName, endDate, isDone);
Event event = new Event(eventName, eventTime, isDone);
+ "Tasks should have been stored with the appropriate format (T, D, or E)";
* Represents a to-do task. A to-do is a task without a date.
* @param isDone Whether to-do is to be marked as done.
* Returns a new to-do object with the isDone field set to true.
* @return to-do object with isDone set to true.
* Returns a new to-do object with the isDone field set to false.
* @return to-do object with isDone set to false.
* Returns the to-do as a String in a format that can be stored.
* Returns a String representing the to-do object.

* Prints a string with line separators to make it
* @param str The string that is to be printed
* Prints a message informing the user that their input does not contain any characters.
return printReply("Hey! You didn't enter any characters!");
